item.title: Fresh Development Setup within 10 Minutes using Winget
item.author: Author
item.description:
Sometimes you have to setup your Laptop/Notebook fresh and also prepare your developer environment and tools you need. I noticed this again today when I rebooted my machine and spent almost 2 hours installing the tools I need to work.

I have put together a list of commands you can use to prepare your environment using Windows Package Manager (WinGet) for you which gives you a kick start at the next reset and you can continue working directly after 10 minutes.

item.title: Automatically clean up local once remote branch is deleted
item.author: Author
item.description: Use this nice PowerShell one-liner to automatically clean up (delete) your local branches once your remote branches is deleted (merged).

item.title: Create Your Static Page With Github Pages and Hugo
item.author: Author
item.description: You can use GitHub Pages to host a website about yourself, your organization, or your project directly from a repository on GitHub.com. Hugo takes Markdown, runs them through a theme template, and spits out HTML files that you can easily deploy online – extremely fast. Why GitHub Pages? GitHub Pages is a static site hosting service that takes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files straight from a repository on GitHub, optionally runs the files through a build process, and publishes a website.

item.title: How to get a list of PowerShell Aliases
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned How to get a list of PowerShell Aliases.

An alias is an alternate name for a cmdlet, function, executable file, including scripts. PowerShell includes a set of built-in aliases. You can add your own aliases to the current session and to your PowerShell profile.

item.title: How to install and update Azure PowerShell 7
item.author: Author
item.description: Let’s keep it easy with these one-liner’s you can use for Windows as well as Linux.

item.title: Azure Pipelines Container Agents for Azure Devops
item.author: Author
item.description: Create self-hosted Azure Pipelines Container Agents for Azure Devops.

item.title: Github Action for Project Bicep (ARM DSL)
item.author: Author
item.description: All ARM enthusiasts among us will now probably cry out and be happy. Microsoft announced a new ARM DSL, called Bicep. I won’t go into too much detail here, as I’m more into how to use a GitHub Action to use Bicep to generate an ARM template out of a .bice file. But let me give you some context to Bicep.

item.title: Azure Github Actions and Workflows
item.author: Author
item.description: Let me give you an introduction how to use the power of GitHub Actions and Workflows to deploy resources into Azure. I’m going to explain you the basics of GitHub Actions, Workflows, runners and how to deploy resources into Azure. At the end of this post you should have understood how GitHub Actions and Workflows work together to give you a kickstart to run your own.

item.title: Programmatically Create Azure Pipelines
item.author: Author
item.description: This script New-AzPipeline lets you programmatically create Azure Pipelines based on your folder structure.

item.title: Function Lock-Workstation locally and remotely
item.author: Author
item.description: You can do everything with PowerShell, as well as locking your workstation with one simple function call.
